intro: Manulea oppositiflora var. angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved manulea, is a flowering plant species native to specific regions of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant typically has slender, opposite leaves that are often narrow and lance-shaped, giving it its varietal name. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
